title: bluefirecorp_
author: bluefirecorp_
content: No one attended.The invite for the party was published in newspapers the day after the event.This was the first time a party for time travelers was documented in history.However, it was wiped from the digital internet and replaced with the digital era story of Hawking replicating the Einstein experiment with similar results.

comments.author: NotFuzzyWarm
comments.created_time: November 10, 2022, 09:39:27 PMLast edit: November 10, 2022, 10:44:32 PM by NotFuzzyWarm
comments.body: QuoteHowever, it was wiped from the digital internet and replaced with the digital era story of Hawking replicating the Einstein experiment with similar results."digital internet"? Um, is there some other one???That said, I've actually read many of Einstein's papers as in actual published books printed in the 1950's and there is ZERO mention of him doing that.And just *who/why* did the supposed removal of it's mention in all books/papers/etc? Aliens?

comments.author: mpufatzis
comments.body: I think you are mistaken, it was Stephen Hawking.Here is an article about it:https://vinepair.com/articles/stephen-hawking-time-travel-party/Quote from: bluefirecorp_ on November 10, 2022, 05:35:41 AMNo one attended.The invite for the party was published in newspapers the day after the event.This was the first time a party for time travelers was documented in history.However, it was wiped from the digital internet and replaced with the digital era story of Hawking replicating the Einstein experiment with similar results.

comments.author: MysteryMiner
comments.body: Quote from: mpufatzis on November 13, 2022, 05:54:49 PMI think you are mistaken, it was Stephen Hawking.Here is an article about it:https://vinepair.com/articles/stephen-hawking-time-travel-party/Quote from: bluefirecorp_ on November 10, 2022, 05:35:41 AMNo one attended.The invite for the party was published in newspapers the day after the event.This was the first time a party for time travelers was documented in history.However, it was wiped from the digital internet and replaced with the digital era story of Hawking replicating the Einstein experiment with similar results.Yes, it was Hawking not Einstein. I traveled to alleged Einsteins party and it was empty.

comments.author: digaran
comments.body: So they invited people after the party was over? What now?, time travel doesn't exist, not real.

comments.author: franky1
comments.body: time travel is only into the future. not backwardstime VIEWING of the past is possible, from great distance or use of mirrors and lenses at a great distance to beam the light emissions outbound to come inboundyou can travel to great distance and by the time you get back you will realise your family have grown up during the time you were not presentalso while at the great distant using the right tech of mirrors and lenses you can capture the light emitted from the past and watch a re-run of the past

comments.body: Quote from: franky1 on December 08, 2022, 06:40:35 AMtime travel is only into the future. not backwardstime VIEWING of the past is possible, from great distance or use of mirrors and lenses at a great distance to beam the light emissions outbound to come inboundyou can travel to great distance and by the time you get back you will realise your family have grown up during the time you were not presentalso while at the great distant using the right tech of mirrors and lenses you can capture the light emitted from the past and watch a re-run of the past Find this super interesting, by luck do you have any link to give more details about it ?

comments.author: Blawpaw
comments.body: This was actually something proposed by Stephen Hawking. He threw a party as an experience to prove that time travel is not a reality or at least it os not possible to do it backwards. The reasoning behind it was that no showed up and that proved that travelling back in time is not possible. You can learn more about this here:https://vinepair.com/articles/stephen-hawking-time-travel-party/
